title: Turkish parliament approves holding snap elections on June 24
text:
April 20, 2018 / 2:37 PM / Updated 42 minutes ago Turkish parliament approves holding snap elections on June 24 Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
ANKARA (Reuters) - Turkeyâ€™s parliament approved on Friday a proposal to hold presidential and parliamentary elections on June 24, more than a year ahead of schedule, after President Tayyip Erdogan said they should be held early. FILE PHOTO: Turkish President Tayyip Erdogan waves during a news conference in Bulgaria, March 26, 2018. REUTERS/Stoyan Nenov/File Photo 
Parliamentarians from the opposition pro-Kurdish HDP party walked out of parliament in protest before the vote. The remaining deputies all supported the motion. Reporting by Gulsen Solaker; Writing by Dominic Evans; Editing by Ali Kucukgocmen
